channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trapped pigeons, 5th November
item.description:
Pigeons can get through the netting and can't get out. You can see one already dead in the pic with others trapped. Please either fix or remove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Opposite entrance to Crickley Hill Country Park

item.description:
Pavement outside number 44 priors road

item.title: Really loose flags where the subsoil has washed away, 5th November
item.description:
I’ve just had a resident telling me how they tripped and hurt their elbow and hip on these flags. Somebody needs to lift them, level the subsoil and replace them. I’m not sure whether it was a city fibre job, but we have a serious problem here, almost a sinkhole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-3, Princess Elizabeth Way, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping. Whole seat includes g headrest out of a car dumped in the lay-by. Seen yesterday 4/11/2023,, 5th November
item.description:
Flytipping. Encourages others to.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Farmer ploughed too close to hedge, 5th November
item.description:
The farmer has ploughed too close to the edge of the field and has made it very difficult to walk along the footpath. There used to be a 1m wide grass covered path running along the edge of the field which has now been ploughed and seeded with Barley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley Lane, Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Visibility poor turning out of Clarence Sq, Cheltenham, 4th November
item.description:
Turning left or right out of Clarence Square by Camden House. The tree is a weeping birch so the branches hang low down, and obstruct pedestrian and road user views. Long-standing issue, more dangerous when tree has leaves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 4th November
item.description:
letter received to clear ditches on land - this has now been done but the there is an outfall pipe on the carriageway that is blocked and the road is now flooded
